title: South Africa 66-7 Canada: Cobus Reinach hat-trick helps Springboks into World Cup quarter-final
text:
South Africa booked their quarter-final place with an emphatic 10-try Pool B win over 14-man Canada.

Scrum-half Cobus Reinach ran in three first-half tries while Damian de Allende, S'busiso Nkosi, Warrick Gelant and Frans Steyn helped establish a first-half lead.

Canada were reduced to 14 men when Josh Larsen was red carded late in the first period - the tournament's sixth dismissal alread.

Northampton scrum-half Cobus Reinach grabbed three tries for South Africa against Canada

Warrick Gelant grabbed his second try of the tournament having also scored against Namibia

South Africa have now booked their place in the quarter-finals of the World Cup in Japan

However, they started the second half well with a score from Matt Heaton that Peter Nelson converted.

The revival did not last long as Schalk Brits, Damian Willemse and Frans Malherbe all crossed to seal victory by 59 points.

Fly-half Elton Jantjies kicked eight conversions in total, as the Springboks moved into the next round where Ireland, Japan or Scotland await.

Elton Jantjies kicked eight conversions worth 16 points from fly-half for his country

Centre Damian de Allende set his side off to the perfect start with a try after two minutes

Wing S'busiso Nkosi went over early for the Springboks on their way to a comfortable victory

Springboks coach Rassie Erasmus clearly had an eye on the knock-out rounds, ringing 13changes including a first tournament start for Reinach plus a place for Damian Willemse - an injury call-up for Jesse Kriel - at full-back.

Comfortable bonus-point victories over Namibia and Italy - following an opening 23-12 defeat by New Zealand - meant that South Africa were all-but assured of a quarter-final place before kick-off but a bonus-point win would seal it.

After only two minutes, de Allende, one of only two players retained in the starting line-up, profited from a break by RG Snyman to touch down.

Within three minutes, wing Nkosi went over in the corner for the second.

Canada forward Josh Larsen was sent off late in the first half for a shoulder charge at a ruck

Frans Steyn produced an intercept try to cross from close range for the final try of the first half

Having conceded, South Africa hit back straight away through veteran hooker Schalk Brits

MATCH FACTS SOUTH AFRICA: Willemse, Gelant, de Allende, Steyn, Nkosi, E Jantjies, Reinach, T. du Toit, Brits, Koch, Snyman, Mostert, Kolisi, Smith, Louw. REPLACEMENTS: Marx, Kitshoff, Malherbe, Etzebeth, P du Toit, H Jantjies, Pollard, le Roux. TRIES: de Allende, Nkosi, Reinach (3), Gelant, Steyn, Brits, Willemse, Malherbe CONS: E Jantjies (8) CANADA: Coe, Hassler, Trainor, Hearn, van der Merwe, Nelson, Mack, Buydens, Quattrin, Ilnicki, Olmstead, Baillie, Rumball, Heaton, Ardron. REPLACEMENTS: Piffero, Sears-Duru, Tierney, Larsen, Sheppard, Mackenzie, O'Leary, du Toit. TRY: Heaton CON: Nelson

Reniach claimed his first after nine minutes as he gathered his own kick to cross and grabbed another following more powerful running by Snyman.

He then sprinted half the length of the field to claim his third and South Africa scored again when Warrick Gelant weaved his way through the Canucks defence.

Canada's night got even worse when Larsen was sent off before the break following a foul play review by the TMO and they were breached again when Frans Steyn crashed over from close range.

The Springboks made a slow start to the second half and Canada registered a consolation when Jeff Hassler drove to the line and Matt Heaton forced his way over.

Normal service was soon resumed, however, as veteran hooker Brits claimed a well-worked try and Willemse went over from a scrum.

Frans Malherbe powered through the defence for South Africa's 10th try eight minutes from time.

Damian Willemse, a late injury call-up for Jesse Kriel, scored hi side's ninth try from full-back
description: South Africa booked their quarter-final place with an emphatic 10-try Pool B win over 14-man Canada. Scrum-half Cobus Reinach ran in three first-half tries.
